bug.author: villmow
bug.summary: Validation happens after every epoch, validate_interval is ignored
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>ğŸ› Bug</denchmark-h>
I used to set the validation (epoch) frequency with --validate_interval. Currently on master validation is triggered after every epoch and i can't find a way to trigger validation only every x epochs. Has there been a change that caused this behaviour? Is this wanted? Looking at the code in master, I assume that train.py has been refactored from this:
fairseq/train.py
Lines 103 to 106 in 9ac98bb
if not args.disable_validation and epoch_itr.epoch % args.validate_interval == 0:
valid_losses = validate(args, trainer, task, epoch_itr, valid_subsets)
else:
valid_losses = [None]
To this:
fairseq/fairseq_cli/train.py
Lines 238 to 252 in 9f25ffb
do_save = (
(
args.save_interval_updates > 0
and num_updates > 0
and num_updates % args.save_interval_updates == 0
)
or (end_of_epoch and epoch_itr.epoch % args.save_interval == 0)
)
do_validate = (
(
do_save # saving requires validation
or (end_of_epoch and epoch_itr.epoch % args.validate_interval == 0)
)
and not args.disable_validation
)
And as we're always at the end of an epoch (L244), the argument validate_interval is basically ignored. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
I should be able to trigger validation only every x epochs, but save epoch_checkpoints after every epoch. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
fairseq Version (e.g., 1.0 or master): master

comments.comment: Good point. We generally need a validation loss when saving checkpoints in order to set checkpoint_best.pt properly, but the old behavior kinda ignored this and allowed checkpoint_best to only get updated whenever validation happened to run. I'll revert this to the old behavior.
